answers.answer: Hi!If you are biting your nails then bacteria from your mouth can enter the tender skin beneath the nail that usually gets exposed and abraded or bruised by repeated biting. If the infection is not going away, you will need to apply an antibiotic cream and take anti-inflammatory drugs and maybe oral antibiotics. Also, you may need to get blood sugar tested as diabetes also makes healing difficult. You should ideally consult a doctor to see how deep is the infection because if the bone beneath gets infected then this will be very difficult to treat. Hope this helps.
